metadata.synopsis:
Gale reclaimed the crown of Karsus but never learned the truth about the orb. As a result, when he retrieved the crown and attempted to wear it, crown and orb reacted badly to each other and the orb detonated, obliterating him from existence. At the Withers party, there's a magical projection of Gale there to deliver a final letter to the player he was closest to.

As a projection of Gale (tone-wise, please match the tone of other instances of his SpectralVoice) he's not overly upset by the factof his own death, but in his final moments there's a hint of how much the player meant to the real Gale.

51.speaker: Spectral Voice
51.text: Well met! I am a magical projection of Gale of Waterdeep, and if you see this manifestation, that means I have prematurely perished.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: The speaker here is not the real Gale: Gale is dead. This is a magical projection of him (like the mirror image) or potentially a projection of his face alone floating in a magic haze.

50.speaker: Spectral Voice
50.text: Alas, on this occasion, I appear to have been erased from this plane in both soul and substance, so the usual protocol for re-vivification cannot be followed.
50.context: NodeContext: An air of reciting a pre-prepared script

16.speaker: Spectral Voice
16.text: I am, however, available for the duration of this spell to assist with the tying of any loose ends related to my recent departure from mortality.
16.context: NodeContext: An air of reciting a pre-prepared script

57.speaker: Player
57.text: You can't be dead! You promised you'd take me to the heavens with you!

4.speaker: Spectral Voice
4.text: I am merely a projection of Gale of Waterdeep, and therefore made you no such promises.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I hear you have a letter for me.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I hear you have a letter to deliver. Is it for me?

28.speaker: Spectral Voice
28.text: I'm afraid not. If you could encourage the correct recipient to come forward at their earliest convenience, that would be most appreciated.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: What's this 'protocol for revivification' you mentioned?

67.speaker: Spectral Voice
67.text: A sequence of elegantly designed failsafes to be executed in order to reverse the occurrence of my unexpected but impermanent demise.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Gods, even death isn't enough to shut you up...

35.speaker: Spectral Voice
35.text: Quite the opposite. My 'funeral protocol' runs to several hours of riveting speeches, tributes, and instructions as to the beneficiaries of my various wizarding sundries.
35.context: NodeContext: Excited at the thought of delivering this protocol

83.speaker: Spectral Voice
83.text: As I am unable to detect any trace of my existence in reach of mortal magic, however, such a protocol would in this instance be destined to fail.
83.context: NodeContext: Comforting the player, as this is something beyond their powers to execute

24.speaker: Spectral Voice
24.text: However, on behalf of my creator, I wish to make abundantly clear that my death was an unfortunate accident, and in no way related to any attempted usurpation of the reigning divinities of the day.
24.context: NodeContext: An air of reciting a pre-prepared script, brightly unaware that this sentence implies the exact opposite

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Did you find the Crown of Karsus?

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I know what happened to you Gale. Raphael told me.

17.speaker: Spectral Voice
17.text: I assure you, any claims of my intention to pursue Mystra's place in the pantheon have been greatly exaggerated.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: If I can't resurrect you, then why are you here?

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Exactly what someone who tried to usurp a goddess would say...

68.speaker: Spectral Voice
68.text: Then permit me to relay the truth, as far as I was witness to it.

41.speaker: Spectral Voice
41.text: Retrieving the crown from the muddy floor of the Chionthar was surprisingly straightforward, if a little damp.

19.speaker: Spectral Voice
19.text: I recall standing on the riverside, the icy chill of Netherese metal in my hands, and then...

53.speaker: Spectral Voice
53.text: Nothing. Gale of Waterdeep was gone. And so was I, until Withers kindly summoned me here to perform my final task.

37.speaker: Spectral Voice
37.text: I have been entrusted with the delivery of a letter, to be read by the one to whom I promised divinity.

80.speaker: Spectral Voice
80.text: I hope these words do something to ease the tragedy of my untimely and honestly quite unexpected passing.

71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gestures with his hands, magically summoning a letter that hovers between him and the player. The player takes it and puts it away. (Reuse if we can/have to. Otherwise, for mocap - an elegant gesture with Gale's hands to 'draw' it into existence. Greg knows)

7.speaker: Spectral Voice
7.text: With that, I'm afraid my spell is waning. Is there anything else you need of me, before I blink out of existence?

10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gestures with his hands, magically summoning a letter that hovers between him and the player. The player takes it and puts it away. (Reuse if we can/have to. Otherwise, for mocap - an elegant gesture with Gale's hands to 'draw' it into existence. Greg knows)

6.speaker: Spectral Voice
6.text: With that, I'm afraid my spell is waning. Is there anything else you need of me, before I blink out of existence?

64.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player leans in to kiss Gale, but he's not really there. They pass through him, then pull away - saddened. Gale smiles sadly to himself.

61.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player leans in to kiss Gale, but he's not really there. They pass through him, then pull away - saddened. Gale smiles sadly to himself.

33.speaker: Spectral Voice
33.text: I can see why I loved you.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: A final meaningful look between Gale and the player, before he vanishes/fades away.NodeContext: A note of surprise - the spectral Gale has never kised anyone before, knows what you want to hear. Note of farewell - this is the last line Gale will ever say to the player

38.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player leans in to hug Gale, but he's not really there. They pass through him, then pull away - saddened. Gale smiles sadly to himself.

62.speaker: Spectral Voice
62.text: How fortunate I was, to know someone like you.
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: A final meaningful look between Gale and the player, before he vanishes/fades away.NodeContext: Note of farewell/mild surprise from the projection - he's making an observation on the actions of the real Gale, as opposed to feeling the full weight of sadness that the real Gale would in this moment. This is the last line Gale will ever say to the player

39.speaker: Spectral Voice
39.text: To think I believed godhood was worth losing all this...
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: A final meaningful look between Gale and the player, before he vanishes/fades away.NodeContext: Note of farewell/mild surprise from the projection - he's making an observation on the actions of the real Gale, as opposed to feeling the full weight of sadness that the real Gale would in this moment. This is the last line Gale will ever say to the player

11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player leans in to hug Gale, but he's not really there. They pass through him, then pull away - saddened. Gale smiles sadly to himself.

76.speaker: Spectral Voice
76.text: If you'd be so kind as to pass that message on, then I can pass the message on, so to speak.

78.speaker: Spectral Voice
78.text: I have been entrusted with the delivery of a letter, to be read by the one who loved me most.

20.speaker: Spectral Voice
20.text: I have been entrusted with the delivery of a letter, to be given to one who cared most for me in life.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I don't believe this. You're really gone?

43.speaker: Spectral Voice
43.context: NodeContext: Fairly matter of fact - commiserations being given by someone who doesn't fully understand/recogise emotion

81.speaker: Spectral Voice
81.text: The good news is, I am here precisely to assist in cushioning that heaviest of blows.
81.context: NodeContext: Brightening to his purpose in being here

45.speaker: Player
45.text: It's good to see you again, Gale. I've missed you.

25.speaker: Spectral Voice
25.text: As I said, I am merely a projection of Gale. A highly accomplished one, reflecting my creator's flair for such magic, but in no way am I the great wizard himself. He is gone.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I don't understand. Why can't I bring you back this time?

40.speaker: Spectral Voice
40.text: I'm afraid the nature of my untimely and tragic demise makes salvaging any vestiges of my mortal existence quite impossible.

60.speaker: Spectral Voice
60.text: As a precautionarily prepared spell, I'm afraid I wasn't witness to the exact nature of my demise.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: No loose ends for me. If Gale died trying to usurp a god, that's on him.

63.speaker: Spectral Voice
63.text: Your words may feign indifference, but I can only assume they are a facade behind which your true heartbreak is keenly felt.
